category: Physical environment; Hardware, software or communications equipment andfacilities
name: Exploitation of security vulnerability
description: Shortcoming in repository’s security provisions is identified and used togain unauthorised access.
notes:
- Are vulnerabilities conceivably evident within repository's physical and system security?
- Is it possible that individuals internal or external to the repository might be motivated to compromise system security to acquire or vandalise materials?
- Are archived materials stored on network accessible computers? 

The full description of this risk has been obtained from examples provided in DRAMBORA - Digital Repository Audit Method Based on Risk Assessment, March 2007, Digital Curation Centre (DCC) and Digital Preservation Europe (DPE), http://www.repositoryaudit.eu/
preMitigationNotes:
- Unpatched software security loophole hack
- Intruder gains physical access to repository through a security door that is wedged open
mitigationStrategy:
Avoidance strategies:
- Establish and regularly evaluate policies and procedures for physical and software security in accordance with relevant standards
- Limit execution of non-essential services
- Update software with latest security patches
- Allocate staff time to analyse attempted security compromises and monitor security sources for details of known vulnerabilities
- Compel users to change passwords frequently In the event of risk’s execution:
- Rebuild system to ensure there are no residual effects of system compromise
identifiedBy: DRAMBORA - Digital Repository Audit Method Based on Risk Assessment
